result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Abdul Hasan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge. To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.   Balance to be paid by 5/13/19.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with John P.
No drivers license suspension.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, calendar successor, for review.  spc
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (38 pages) commencing MAY 13, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 86 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/13/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/13/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with John P.
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Charles Abdul Hasan not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for an adjourned plea and sentence date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Original Information filed previously.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 4/9/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defense motion to strike SECOND AND SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE is reviewed and granted by the Court. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.

Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in custody.  Ron Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Arraignment scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Charles Abdul Hasan in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
